content.raw:
I suggest removing some unnecessary includes:

~~~
diff -r 4c182f4b4821 include/ignition/gazebo/TestSystem.hh
--- a/include/ignition/gazebo/TestSystem.hh	Thu Apr 19 09:59:45 2018 -0300
+++ b/include/ignition/gazebo/TestSystem.hh	Thu Apr 19 10:01:17 2018 -0300
@@ -17,7 +17,6 @@
 #ifndef IGNITION_GAZEBO_TESTSYSTEM_HH_
 #define IGNITION_GAZEBO_TESTSYSTEM_HH_
 
-#include "ignition/gazebo/Entity.hh"
 #include "ignition/gazebo/System.hh"
 
 namespace ignition
diff -r 4c182f4b4821 src/TestSystem.cc
--- a/src/TestSystem.cc	Thu Apr 19 09:59:45 2018 -0300
+++ b/src/TestSystem.cc	Thu Apr 19 10:01:17 2018 -0300
@@ -14,12 +14,9 @@
  * limitations under the License.
  *
 */
+
 #include "ignition/gazebo/TestSystem.hh"
 
-#include <vector>
-#include <iostream>
-#include "ignition/gazebo/Entity.hh"
-
 using namespace ignition::gazebo;
 
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
~~~

May I ask what's the motivation for adding this system? I don't see it used in any tests.

+
 #include "ignition/gazebo/TestSystem.hh"

-#include <vector>

-
 using namespace ignition::gazebo;

May I ask what's the motivation for adding this system? I don't see it used in any tests.

content.raw:
Removed: 56c9b4f

This system will go away relatively quickly. It is only here to facilitate the implementation and manual testing of the server, entities, and components.  Systems require Entities and Components to be implemented, but it's hard to test the implementation of Entities and Components without a System. The intent is not to keep this, but to serve as a stop-gap. So, no tests because the tests will come along with the actual System implementation.
content.html:
Removed: 56c9b4f

This system will go away relatively quickly. It is only here to facilitate the implementation and manual testing of the server, entities, and components. Systems require Entities and Components to be implemented, but it's hard to test the implementation of Entities and Components without a System. The intent is not to keep this, but to serve as a stop-gap. So, no tests because the tests will come along with the actual System implementation.
